FuncDef:
The sm2 peer-public-key command displays the SM2 public key view.
The undo sm2 peer-public-key command deletes SM2 public key configuration. The sm2 peer-public-key command displays the SM2 public key view. The undo sm2 peer-public-key command deletes SM2 public key configuration. By default, no SM2 public key is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an SM2 public key.
The value is a string of 1 to 40 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported. The string can contain only letters, digits, and underscores (_).

ExtraInfo: If an SM2 public key is used for authentication, you need to enter the SM2 public key view to edit the public key in the SM2 key pair on the SSH server and generate a new SM2 public key that can be successfully authenticated by the private key in the SM2 key pair. This public key can be bound to an SSH user or client as a credential for server login.
